item.description:
Welcome to our ongoing series of strategy game events, open to everyone but most likely appealing to those of us who frequent BoardGameGeek. ;-)

Tonight's event will be at a private home.

This event will focus on strategy games.  Unlike word games which focus on your language skills, card games which focus on your ability to create patterns and sets and party games which test your general knowledge and creativity, strategy games involve executive level functions.  For example, some games involve money management, others involve timing and planning ahead, some involve designing military planning etc.

Some examples of strategy games people in this group have been known to enjoy are:

  • 7 Wonders
  • Carcassonne
  • Ra
  • Cutthroat Caverns
  • Dominion
  • Ticket to Ride
  • Pandemic
  • Settlers of Catan

Some nights we may even attack a long term game such as Dominant Species or Arkham Horror.

So if you like any of these games or want to learn more about this genre, this event will be for you.  We welcome new players with open arms.

We will leave it up to group choice on what we play that night so please bring your favorites (in fact, what we play is usually dependent on what people bring, we don't really dip into my collection). If necessary, we will divide into smaller groups depending on group size and game preferences.

---

To accomodate people who will be joining us straight from work, the doors open at 6pm, where we will have a dinner period (I will supply pizza and basic soda, please bring additional snacks) and maybe a warm-up game with the main event starting at 7pm.  So please join us at whichever of those times is best for you.

No real curfew but the host usually loses focus and energy around 2am. ;-)

---

About the location:  
This event will be hosted at a private residence, conveniently located at the intersections of Route 1 and Route 95.  If you need directions, just ask.  This is a housing complex, so please do NOT park in any numbered spaces.  There are no animals on the premises and the property should be child-friendly.  Look for Unit 901 since Meetup doesn't display addresses correctly! :-(
